page.syntax: V BITMAP_TRANSLUCENT(C bitmap_name,N XPos,N YPos,N opacity[,C transparent_color])

argument.name: bitmap_name
argument.description: The name of the bitmap to be modified.

argument.name: XPos
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the pixel to be modified.

argument.name: YPos
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the pixel to be modified.

argument.name: opacity
argument.description: The amount of opacity to retain. 0 = Transparent. 100 = Opaque.

argument.name: transparent_color
argument.description: Optional. The color to use to select pixels in the bitmap. Always considered to be totally transparent.

page.description: Draw a translucent bitmap (with opacity 100-0 for 100% to 0%) - optional transparent color is always treater 0% opacity.
page.discussion: The BITMAP_TRANSLUCENT() function draws a translucent bitmap . Limitations: Used only in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example places an image named stripes.bmp with 40% transparency over an image named toucan.bmp.

section.example: ui_bitmap_create("test",4,2) stripe_data = file.to_blob("c:\documents\Xbasic Reference\Images\stripes.bmp") ui_bitmap_load("stripes", stripe_data) bird_data = file.to_blob("c:\documents\Xbasic Reference\Images\toucan.bmp") ui_bitmap_load("bird", bird_data) ui_bitmap_draw("test", <<%code% inner_rect(0, 0, 4, 2) bitmap("bird", 0, 0) bitmap_translucent("stripes", 0, 0, 40) %code%) ui_dlg_box("image", <<%dlg% {image=test} %dlg%)
